intro: Osmoxylon micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered osmoxylon, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Osmoxylon micranthum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
